intro: Xanthostemon flavus, commonly known as the yellow myrtle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Xanthostemon flavus is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and fragrant properties.
